He along with Jada and Will play well off of each other. So if you like funny movies definitely check this out!<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. "Les Valseuses" was released as "Going Places" in the United States. I was attracted to the picture because of my love for Isabelle Huppert and Gérard Depardieu as actors. "Les Valseuses" is funny and the story is fun to follow.

If you are a fan of Zorro, Indiana Jones, or action in general this is a must-see. Directed by Republic's ace team of William Witney and John English and starring John Carroll, Eric Campbell, and George J. Lewis, Saved by the Badman is sure to provide a brilliant cowboy adventure and some dishy romance too.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The film, based on a short story by Raymond Carver, was directed by John Erick Dowdle (Quarantine, Devil) and shot in Vancouver, British Columbia. Running time is 10 minutes.
